1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: To deceive, lie, speak falsely. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
1.str2: To bear witness together with. From sun and martureo; to testify jointly, i.e. Corroborate by evidence.

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

Large, great, in the widest sense.
Pain, grief, sorrow, affliction. Apparently a primary word; sadness.
Pain, sorrow, distress, of body or mind. From duno; grief.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
